intro: Rosa villosa f. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed rose, is a compact, shrub-like plant native to the eastern United States. It features glossy, dark green leaves with a smooth texture, distinguishing it from its parent species. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) stems and foliage, which give it its specific epithet. Rosa villosa f. glabrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
